snippet: The crackdown in Qinghai Province comes as the number of self-immolations approached 100, with the government stepping up its campaign to quell protests by those seeking greater freedom for Tibetans.
abstract: Police in Qinghai Province of western China arrest 12 people and detain dozens more who are accused of playing part in acts of self-immolation by Tibetan monks and others protesting Chinese rule; crackdown comes as number of self-immolations approaches 100, with government stepping up its campaign to quell protests by those seeking greater freedom for Tibetans.
lead_paragraph: The crackdown in Qinghai Province comes as the number of self-immolations approached 100, with the government stepping up its campaign to quell protests by those seeking greater freedom for Tibetans.

headline.seo: China Makes Arrests in Crackdown on Immolations
headline.main: Battling Self-Immolations, China Makes More Arrests
headline.print_headline: Battling Self-Immolations, China Makes More Arrests
